cyclone.name: BETA
cyclone.trajectory: Moving very slowly west-northwest toward the central Texas coast, then forecast to slow further and turn north-northeast along the upper Texas coastline and into Louisiana mid-week.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near or just north of Port O'Connor, TX (central Texas coast)
cyclone.hours_to_offshore: 0 (storm remains inland after landfall, does not move back offshore near Galveston)

weather_observation.under_warning: Tropical Storm Warning, Storm Surge Warning
weather_observation.watch_coast: Baffin Bay to Port Aransas TX (Tropical Storm Watch)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Port Aransas TX to Morgan City LA (Tropical Storm); Port Aransas TX to Rockefeller Wildlife Refuge LA including Galveston Bay (Storm Surge)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Middle and upper Texas coast through southwestern Louisiana, including Galveston Bay
weather_observation.wind: Sustained tropical-storm-force winds (35-45 kt) likely with gusts to 60 mph; low (11%) chance of 50-kt winds.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Peak inundation for Galveston Bay expected 3–5 ft above ground if peak surge coincides with high tide.
weather_observation.rainfall: 6–12 inches possible with isolated 15 inches, creating flash and urban flooding risk.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes, dangerous surf and rip currents, prolonged high water levels due to the storm’s slow movement.
